message: Day[9]'s vids are amazingly instructional, whether you're a semi-pro or just starting out
#254 was an especially good ZvT analysis, and I hear #252 is really good all-around advice
I actually prefer Husky to Day9
I discovered Day[9] through Husky. I think Husky's more entertainment and Day[9] is more high-level strategy
Funday monday just started and I think it'll be a good one.  http://www.ustream.tv/day9tv
what's the newbie tuesday for this week
Day[9] is the man!  His Daily has been a routine of mine for some time now.  Super helpful and awesome contributor to the community.  Cant wait till he has a primetime show!  :D
So I think a good 5 lines review of the last episodes would be useful, I'm sure some are still pinning down very useful strategies and tactics. Plus Day9 is fun! :)

I don't watch Day9 anymore. I find that's now too long for too few information (been watching since the beginning, played Broodwar and Warcraft III competitively), now that I spend only 5-8 hours / week in an around the game.
I can't stand Husky, but I admit he's good for the exposure/scene. Same with HD.
I like Husky and Day9 both. What I dislike is the barrage of horrible home-computing 'me-too' people who want a slice of the pie
Eh, both are having fun while casting, I don't begrudge them that.
I don't like HD's casting with statements like 'the warriors from aiur are victorious' etc, they're just dudes playing a game, we get it
You are always going to have level. Casual and harcore and HD and Husky are quick fun cast to watch and listen to unlike an hour Day9 daily.
They are long, but if you have time they're definitely the best SC2 analysis out there. Plus, day[9] is hilarious.
